alert.note: Alert for Creek; Nowata; Okfuskee; Rogers; Tulsa; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 04 at 2:32PM CST until March 05 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: .A dry line will move into western portions of Osage and Pawnee counties Saturday afternoon, with rapidly falling humidity and gusty west to southwest winds. The dry line may move as far east as a Nowata to Okemah line by late afternoon or early evening, and this would result in rapidly deteriorating fire weather conditions. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR VERY DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR northeast oklahoma... The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...IN Oklahoma, Washington, Nowata, Tulsa, Rogers, Creek, and Okfuskee counties. * WIND...South to southwest winds 25 to 40 mph. * HUMIDITY...Afternoon RH values falling into the 20 to 25 percent range. * TEMPERATURE...Highs 75 to 80. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A fire weather watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur.

area.areaDesc: Creek; Nowata; Okfuskee; Rogers; Tulsa; Washington
